author: SD
text: This was my first time trying TRR, but so disappointed with my experience. The order sent to me was the wrong item, brand, color. It was so unfortunate because it was due to arrive before an event I wanted to use it for. Customer service has not been helpful. I had to follow up twice to make sure I knew what was happening with my item but they were more concerned about getting the wrong item back. It’s been almost a month since I purchased the item and I still don’t have my refund or credit I used for the purchase. I’m hesitant to try again, especially since the item I purchased was not cheap.
title: Disappointed with first purchase

author: Christy
text: TheRealReal appeared to be a reputable merchant for designer items- purchased a couple pairs of Gucci shoes and was very excited about it- upon delivery one of the pairs had a pricing sticker of $199 on the shoe box, clearly a part of TheRealReal’s packaging. Surprised and deflated as I had paid $700+ for the pair. Took a few tries to get ahold of their customer service via text and their response was to say that their pricing is structured through their marketing team. Regardless the entire experience was unorganized and made me wary of how they price their items. Terrible customer service system as I couldn’t speak to anyone who had a satisfactory explanation for why this shipment even got fulfilled with a price tag attached that doesn’t match the charge. If anything, the experience of purchasing something special and luxurious was robbed as I unpacked that box. Will be looking elsewhere in the future.
title: TheRealReal appeared to be a reputable…

author: customer
text: My consignment items were lost. It took me reaching out to CS via email, phone, and showing up to a physical store to get some help. It took over a month to get some resolution. After I was assured my case was escalated and would be handled properly, the items that should have been returned to me were sent to a random CVS in Texas, not my address in CA. At this point Ive reached out to CS again and heard nothing back, now my items are missing a second time. I'm DONE with this company.
title: My consignment items were lost

author: Luis Pena-Hernandez, MD
text: I purchased and item, a pair of shoes. It was a $100 item. My size is usually 8.5. Well, this pair would have been returned by me. Except for the fact that it was a final sale. It’s not the customer experience I was expecting. $100 are not going to make me broke. But it’s the principle.

author: Leah
text: The Gucci Bag I purchased was a great deal and described as "Good, Moderate discoloration at interior, light marks at back, light scratches at hardware". I wasn't expecting a new bag, and was fine with all issues listed above, however, when I received the bag, the lining was a mess. The photos showed some minor issues however, this was completely frayed and falling apart. The real let down was when I put something inside the bag, I realized the interior is literally melting. My wallet was covered in a brownish goo. I love the look of this bag but unfortunately I'm afraid to put anything inside of it, rendering it sort of pointless.
title: Definitely in worse shape than described.

author: Bag Buyer
text: I have purchased from these type of shops before, but this was my first time buying from The RealReal.  I stupidly didn't look at the return policy and I'm shocked they aren't allowed.  The bag I received was supposed to be in good condition. It was absolutely not.  It was terrible.  I'd like to return it but that's not allowed apparently.  Shop at Fashionphile - they allow returns and I've not had a poor bag quality like this yeat.
title: Bag in poor condition and no returns allowed!  Read the fine print! BEWARE
